@eclinical Thanks! Part of it is the Tao of @tedeytan: the conversation is never over (and let's get everyone in on it). Part of it is an anxiety hack: I've shared it so if I forget to say it on stage, it's OK.
@VentureValkyrie @drnic1 Yes! I have told him about the upgrade I got as a teenager to an extra-long phone cord so I could talk to friends in my room

@drnic1 My kid came home from school talking about how his teacher was explaining the concept of Blockbuster, that you had to physically go to a store to get a movie and the one you want may already be rented. Bizarre to him.
@drnic1 Agree! Here's the tweet I shared right before this one: https://t.co/uTjumUaUOs

"In many situations, finding just one similar case can be critical in proving the causality of a putative mechanism." - @euanashley and team in @NEJM
(Translation: #PeerHealthAdvice can help people find answers.)
"We also encourage and help [Undiagnosed Disease Network] patients to make use of the Internet and social-media platforms to find similar patients." - @euanashley and team in @NEJM #PeerHealthAdvice
